questions.neutral: Is the city acting weird lately?

hobby.message: Origami's still better than meds, huh?
Any new mods on your FPV quad?

wrong_hobby_answer: That's not me. In free time, I fly FPV drones. It's a way to escape the noise of the city.
neutral_answer: Things are tense. Feels like the air itself is listening.
I fly drones at night. Harder now with all this surveillance creeping in.
Last time out, almost lost signal twice in the old tram yards.
Better to keep low these days.
Yeah, systems seem tighter than before.
I fly FPV drones. Used to clear my head after work.
Now, every signal feels like it gets flagged.
Last night, interference cut me off fast.
Makes the hobby riskier, for no good reason.
Definitely feels different, especially out past curfew.
I do freestyle FPV drone flying—usually out by the industrial zones.
With the subnet news, city mesh is scanning everything.
Last flight, latency shot up and my wristband spooked.
Not fun when tech you trust turns on you.
Used to be just noise and wind.
It’s weird. Feels like the city’s watching all the time, not just recording.
I fly FPV drones—full manual control, pushing signal through the dead zones.
Last run, Directorate vans scanned sector six. Even private video feeds glitched out.
After that ghost subnet leak, network policing stepped up everywhere.
Flight logs flagged my profile when I got home.
Wasn’t always like this. City used to ignore people who kept to themselves.
Honestly, it’s more than weird. Feels like we’re inside the algorithms, not just under them.
I’ve flown FPV drones for years. Used to help me disconnect from the city.
Since the Halden thing, everything’s changed—airspace feels crowded with watchers now.
They’re scraping for rogue signals nonstop since those “invisible users” came out.
My last flight, signal lag nearly crashed my quad. Not random interference—intentional deep scan on all frequencies.
I got wristband warnings just for being in the wrong zone.
Feels personal. Like the system’s closing in on anything unmodeled, even hobbies.
Miss when I could fly for the rush, not just out of habit.
hobby_answer: Yeah. Still fly, when I can.
Keeps the noise out better than anything else.
City's not as empty as it looks lately.

Don't risk going far these days.
Yeah, still flying drones.
Not as often, though. Feels riskier.

Even the usual off-grid spots aren't off-limits anymore.
Signal delays spiking every time I fly.
Feels like everything's being watched harder now.
Yeah, FPV's still how I get out of my head.
Finding places to fly isn't easy anymore.
After the subnet thing, more patrols everywhere.
Static and traced signals mess up half my flights now.
Used to lose myself over the rooftops. Lately it's more...dodging and reading alerts.

Yeah, drones keep me sane. Especially after work shifts.
Ever since those BCI ghosts surfaced, off-grid's not safe anymore.
The city's sensors don't sleep now. Street teams, vans—more eyes than ever.
Flight paths trigger system alerts. Had my wristband ping me mid-session last week.
Spots I trusted for years, they're crawling with interference and false tags.
Feels like any joy's got to slip past eight layers of surveillance.
Sometimes I can't tell if I'm escaping or just testing the net.
Still... nothing else gets that kind of freedom, even now.
Yes. FPV flying's how I survive—since before I worked the wearable lab.
Started out wiring scrapped frames with my brother. It was ours.
Past few weeks, everything changed. That 'invisible citizen' leak turned drone runs inside-out.
Net's locked down tighter. Saw Directorate crawling old depots while I was flying. Closest near miss yet.
Telemetry jams spiked—I cracked the pattern. They're hoovering signals, flagging any nonstandard handshake.
Even got a warning on my band for 'unsecured activity.' Never happened before.
Feels like the system's hunting for anyone off the grid, not just 'rogues.'
I still go. But now, it's a silent fight—each flight, a little less free.
